alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 8:35AM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Lawrence and Independence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NEXT SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Black Rock. * WHEN...Until Next Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low lying cultivated land and pastures in Lawrence, Jackson, and Independence counties flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday morning and continue falling to 13.8 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14.0 17.7 Sun 8 AM 17.0 16.2 15.4 Falling Slowly &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
